translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, licks his hands while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

There is no offense if it is unintentional, if he is not thinking, if he is sick, if he licks only the back of the hand, if he licks the hand after wiping a bowl, if he licks the hand after wiping a drinking cup, if he licks the hand after wiping a water filter, if he licks the hand after wiping the mouth, if he licks the hand after wiping away sweat, if he is insane, if he is the first offender.
The second training rule is finished.
